citeinfo.title: Pre-regulatory Landfill Boundary
citeinfo.origin: Inactive Hazardous Waste Branch, Superfunds, Division of Waste Management

pubinfo.publish: North Carolina Division of Waste Management Inactive Hazardous Waste Branch

idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 3; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.3.1.3000

descript.abstract: This data is a representation of the boundaries of pre-regulatory landfills which were visually surveyed under the Hurricane Recovery Act of 2005 and under Senate Bill 1492. All sites reside within Tier 1 and Tier 2 counties as defined by the NC State Energy Internship Program of 2011. Pre-regulatory landfills are non-permitted landfills that closed prior to January 1, 1983 when waste disposal permitting regulations commenced.
descript.purpose: The purpose of this data set is to provide a geographic representation of the pre-regulatory landfill approximate footprints for public distribution. This dataset is intended for general planning and mapping purposes (rather than highly accurate analytical or public health purposes).
descript.supplinf:
This data was initially collected and processed during the Inactive Hazardous Sites Branch (IHSB) Solar Energy Project of 2011. This data was processed as input to determine site suitability for the construction of solar energy farms.
For additional information contact the NC Department of Environment and Natural Resources Inactive Hazardous Sites Branch (http://portal.ncdenr.org/web/wm/sf/ihs). An online copy of the General Assembly of North Carolina Senate Bill 1492 can be found at http://www.ncleg.net/gascripts/BillLookUp/BillLookUp.pl?Session=2007&BillID=S1492.

theme.themekey: North Carolina Department of Environment and Natural Resources

idinfo.useconst: None. Please check sources, scale, accuracy, currentness and other available information. Please confirm that you are using the most recent copy of both data and metadata. Acknowledgement of the Division of Waste Management would be appreciated.

metainfo.metstdn: FGDC Content Standards for Digital Geospatial Metadata

cntorgp.cntorg: NC DENR, Division of Waste Management

enttyp.enttypd: Multi-part polygon layer depicting pre-regulatory landfill footprints

attrdomv.udom: Free Text: List of North Carolina county names

attr.attrdef: Unique identifier for IHSB data: If a site has a federally created EPA ID, that number is used. Otherwise, IHSB creates the number. For this dataset, there may be no EPA ID's. Within the IHS dataset, identifiers assigned by EPA always start with "NCD", "NC" or "NCN"; while those assigned by the IHSB start with "NONCD".
The situs address of the lanfill
The situs city of the landfill
The situs county of the landfill. Note: the site may comprise an area located in more than one county.

attrdomv.udom: Free Text: List of North Carolina county names

attr.attrdef: Acreage of site calculated from GIS boundaries

overview.eaover: This published GIS dataset contains a selection of publicly useful and approved attributes extracted from the IHS Pre-regulatory Landfills Program database such as site name, address, city, county, identifier and calculated acreage.

distinfo.distliab: NC DENR staff have complied this dataset to the best of their abilities using the resources available to them. NC DENR neither verifies nor guarantees the accuracy, reliability, or completeness of any data provided. NC DENR provides this data without warranty of any kind whatsoever, either express or implied. NC DENR shall not be liable for incidental, consequential, or special damages arising out of the use of any data provided by NC DENR .

cntorgp.cntorg: NC Division of Waste Management, Inactive Hazardous Sites Branch

dataqual.logic: County match by spatial overlay; visual inspection using digital NAIP imagery.
dataqual.complete: This data is only partially complete as sites with less than four data points, managed by branches other than IHSB or counties with a Tier 3 designation were excluded

horizpa.horizpar: The data was surveyed by contractors with various GPS receivers. Accuracy is estimated to be within 1-3 meters. Coordinates that comprise boundary corners were manually input.

procstep.procdesc: Data digitized from contractors' reports - coordinates manually input and geometry created using snap-method in ArcGIS 9.3.1
Polygons dissolved by Site ID to create multi-part polygon layer with unique identifiers
